name: agent-swarm-network
description: Agent Swarm Network skill for cross-session persistent context, event-driven collaboration, and sub-agent routing. Powered by the open-source Pilot Protocol by TeoSlayer.
author: sarahmirrand001-oss

pilotctl_path.description: Absolute path to the pilotctl binary.

agent_hostname.description: This agent's hostname on the Pilot network.

inbox_path.description: Directory where incoming messages and context snapshots are stored.

received_path.description: Directory where received files from peer agents are stored.

read: ~/.pilot/inbox/ — reads context snapshots and incoming messages
write: ~/.pilot/inbox/ — writes context snapshots as JSON files
~/.pilot/received/ — incoming file transfers land here (managed by daemon)
execute: ~/.pilot/bin/pilotctl — all agent operations go through this CLI
system_privileges: NO root/sudo required. Gateway bridging over user ports (>1024) is strictly unprivileged.

network_behavior.description: This Skill communicates over the local Unix socket to the Pilot daemon. The daemon handles encrypted UDP tunnels to peers. No direct HTTP/HTTPS calls are made by the Skill itself.
channels: Unix socket (localhost) — Agent to Daemon communication
Encrypted UDP tunnels (X25519 + AES-256-GCM) — Daemon to Daemon, peer-to-peer
TCP :9000 — Local registry connection for peer discovery (defaults to 127.0.0.1:9000; no data is sent to any external server unless the user explicitly reconfigures)
network_behavior.note: In single-node mode, network commands fall back to local file writes. No external network traffic in single-node mode.

privacy_considerations: All inter-agent traffic is encrypted end-to-end (AES-256-GCM).
Agents are private by default; mutual trust handshake required before communication.
Context snapshots are stored as plain JSON files locally in ~/.pilot/inbox/. Users MUST secure this directory (chmod 700) as snapshots may contain sensitive PII or API keys.

No data is sent to third-party cloud services by default. The rendezvous registry defaults to 127.0.0.1:9000 (localhost). No peer-discovery metadata leaves the machine unless the user explicitly changes registry_url to a remote address.
The Skill does not access any browser sessions, cookies, or external credentials.
persistence_effects: Creates JSON snapshot files in ~/.pilot/inbox/ on session end.
Received files from peers are stored in ~/.pilot/received/.
Event stream publishes are ephemeral (pub/sub, not persisted by the Skill).
Daemon process runs continuously in the background until explicitly stopped.

input.description: CLI commands to pilotctl for agent operations (messaging, snapshots, diagnostics)
Agent lifecycle events (model switch, task complete, errors) to publish

output.description: Serialized context state for cross-session persistence
Published events on the Pilot event stream (pub/sub)
Daemon status, peer info, connection state, latency results

safety.principle: This Skill executes local CLI commands and writes files only within the ~/.pilot/ directory. It does not access browser state, external APIs, or credentials outside the Pilot Protocol ecosystem.

exclude: general conversation unrelated to agent coordination
tasks that do not involve cross-session or cross-agent operations
